page.title: 11Alfred Mizen of Mitcham
page.content: Our school, which is named after Alfred Mizen, was built in 1934 on ground which may have been used as an orchard or a golf course. {Mr.Alfred Mizen J.P.}who died in 1946 at the age of 84, was the last of 3 brothers who were well known market gardeners in Mitcham. The nursery was started by their father on a site which is now part of Battersea Park. Later, until 1933,they farmed 200 acres in Mitcham where Lonesome and Eastfields Schools now are.One of the Mizen's houses was pulled down in 1984 to make way for a new building estate called"The Firs" in Grove Rd. The family were great benefactors to Mitcham churches and attended St.Marks and St.Olaves.They were interested in education. Miss Alfreda Mizen gave us money to build our own swimming pool.
